instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02098: What is 820-02098? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
This arrived with no power and no visible signs of liquid damage. <SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON</SIGNAL> was slightly shorted at 0.172 diode and 0v on arrival. <TRANSISTOR>Q5800</TRANSISTOR> was causing the short. Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q5800</TRANSISTOR>/<TRANSISTOR>Q5820</TRANSISTOR>/<TRANSISTOR>Q5840</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U7500</CHIP>.

Short is gone however <SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON</SIGNAL> is only 1.4V now. Under thermal camera something around <TRANSISTOR>Q5800</TRANSISTOR> is getting hot however I have already replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q5800</TRANSISTOR> twice.

What should be checked next?
